animes.review: Literally the best anime ever! Can you truly call yourself a weeb if you have never watched Naruto?!!
Easily one of the greatest productions to ever come out, pure perfection, no plot holes or character flaws. A true Crown Jewel if you will.
Very wholesome, cute and adorable. Never thought I'd get into a sports anime but it was nice, makes me want to play volleyball.
The show is nice or whatever but the fanbase scares me, giving it a 2/5 because of that lol

Loveeee this anime!! It has been a while since I watched an anime that gave me the same vibes as Naruto! I mean an active kid with a demon inside of him and is being hunted by everyone, whose teacher has grey hair, a mask, and is one of the strongest of all time. Immaculate fight scenes I would give it a 10/5 if I could!

A determined brother that would do anything to protect his sister, misunderstood demons and a whole lotta slaying. If you love animes with a lot more tradtional sword fighting this is the one for you.

movies.review: From the visual art to the story plot, it very aesthetically pleasing and made me a little emotional.
Studio Ghibli never misses! This was one of my absolute favorite movies and a staple in my DVD collection.
Within the first few minutes it was already emotional, the changes the characters went through to find their true selves was so beautiful to watch.
If you love the classic show you will love the movie!
It was ok, the show is so much better but this was just ok. Wish the creator would finish the manga or sell it to someone else to finish it *sigh*
If you have never watched Spirited Away you are either lying or missing out! It is one of the best!!!!!

videogames.review: Finishing off a foe by kicking them right into a mountain evokes memories of the anime’s most epic clashes.

videogames.videogamename: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 – Road to Boruto
videogames.review: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 brought back the beloved Ultimate Jutsu and Awakenings battle mechanics, plus it increased the game’s already high fun factor with the ability to switch between characters mid-battle.
The crisp anime visuals got even crispier, the battle mechanics/game pacing were thankfully enhanced.

videogames.videogamename: Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Maxiboost ON
videogames.review: The battle mechanics at the heart of this mech brawler feel like a natural evolution of SEGA’s Virtual-On games, plus its wealth of single and multiplayer content makes it much more valuable than your average anime arena fighter.
Versus is easy on the eyes and easy to play, but its complexities will surprise you and keep you playing it for longer than expected.
There’s a satisfying amount of characters to bring into your stable, a unique battle system, catchy music, and side missions galore.
